featured.text: Celebration often begins with mukaebi (welcoming fire), during which people make a small bonfire in front of their house to guide spirits upon their return back home.
Some see it as a celebration related to the turn of the seasons from winter to spring; others, however, believe that it 16 the adoption of a new calendar.
This often 31 their anniversary celebration, for his rose bouquet always came one month late.

The 1962 celebration "was more enthusiastic -- a lot more people," said one spectator, who as a young newlywed attended Glenn’s first parade and came from her Brooklyn home again for Glenn’s second parade.

other.text: Drinking is part of our national celebrations as well.
21 , our society makes drinking a part of every celebration.
Over the centuries, henna tattoos 16 used in weddings and holiday celebrations because they are thought to carry blessings from the gods.
Our personal celebrations, 22 weddings, promotions, graduations, and anniversaries, are 23 linked with drinking.

definition.zh_def: 慶祝活動，通常為了紀念特定事件或成就而舉行的聚會或儀式。
definition.en_def: A joyful occasion for special festivities to mark an event or an achievement.
definition.example: We had a big celebration for her birthday.
